alert.note: Alert for Lincoln; Socorro (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued February 26 at 12:56PM MST until February 26 at 2:15PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 215 PM MST FOR SOUTHWESTERN LINCOLN AND EAST CENTRAL SOCORRO COUNTIES... At 1253 PM MST, a dust storm was stretched from Three Rivers over Carrizozo and toward White Oaks and will continue expanding northeast. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes Highway 380 between Mile Markers 48 and 78. Locations impacted include... Carrizozo, White Oaks, Nogal, Jicarilla and Oscuro. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms create dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If you encounter a dust storm, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
